```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)

library(p8105.datasets)
```


Focus on NYCAirbnb data.

```{r}
data("nyc_airbnb")

nyc_airbnb = 
  nyc_airbnb |> 
  mutate(stars = review_scores_location / 2) |> 
  select(
    borough = neighbourhood_group, neighbourhood, stars, price, room_type, lat, long) |> 
  filter(
    borough == "Manhattan",
    room_type == "Entire home/apt",
    price %in% 100:500)
```

Let's make a scatterplot!

```{r}
nyc_airbnb |> 
  mutate(text_lable = str_c("Price:$", price, "\nRating: ", stars)) |> 
  plot_ly(
    x = ~lat, y = ~long, color = ~price, text = ~text_lable,
    type = "scatter", mode = "markers", alpha = 0.5) #可以zoom
```

Let's make a box plot!

```{r}
nyc_airbnb |> 
  mutate(neighbourhood = fct_reorder(neighbourhood,price)) |> #按照价格排序
  plot_ly(y = ~price, color = ~neighbourhood, type = "box")
```

Let's make a bar plot!

```{r}
nyc_airbnb |>  
  count(neighbourhood) |> 
  mutate(neighbourhood = fct_reorder(neighbourhood, n)) |>  
  plot_ly(
    x = ~neighbourhood, y = ~n, color = ~neighbourhood, 
    type = "bar", colors = "viridis")
```

```{r}
# Load necessary libraries
library(p8105.datasets)
library(ggplot2)

# Load the restaurant inspection data
restaurant_data <- read.csv("DOHMH_New_York_City_Restaurant_Inspection_Results_20231031.csv")

# Create a bar plot of restaurant grades
ggplot(restaurant_data, aes(x = grade)) +
  geom_bar() +
  labs(title = "Distribution of Restaurant Grades", x = "Grade", y = "Count")

```

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(httr)
library(jsonlite)
```

```{r}
get_all_inspections = function(url) {
  
  all_inspections = vector("list", length = 0)
  
  loop_index = 1
  chunk_size = 50000
  DO_NEXT = TRUE
  
  while (DO_NEXT) {
    message("Getting data, page ", loop_index)
    
    all_inspections[[loop_index]] = 
      GET(url,
          query = list(`$order` = "zipcode",
                       `$limit` = chunk_size,
                       `$offset` = as.integer((loop_index - 1) * chunk_size)
                       )
          ) %>%
      content("text") %>%
      fromJSON() %>%
      as_tibble()
    
    DO_NEXT = dim(all_inspections[[loop_index]])[1] == chunk_size
    loop_index = loop_index + 1
  }
  
  all_inspections
  
}

url = "https://data.cityofnewyork.us/resource/43nn-pn8j.json"

nyc_inspections = 
  get_all_inspections(url) %>%
  bind_rows() 

```

```{r}
nyc_inspections |> 
  count(camis)
```



```{r}
nyc_inspections_tidy <- nyc_inspections %>%
   mutate(
    grade_date = as.POSIXct(grade_date, format = "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S")
  ) %>%
  group_by(camis) %>%
  filter(grade_date == max(grade_date)) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  select(
    camis, borough = boro, building, street, zipcode, cuisine_description,
    score, grade, inspection_type, latitude, longitude
  ) %>%
  filter(
    !is.na(grade)
  )

nyc_inspections_tidy <- distinct(nyc_inspections_tidy, camis, .keep_all = TRUE)
```

```{r}
nyc_inspections_tidy %>%
  mutate(text_label = str_c("Score: ", score, "\nGrade: ", grade)) %>%
  plot_ly(
    x = ~latitude, y = ~longitude, color = ~score, text = ~text_label,
    type = "scatter", mode = "markers", alpha = 0.5
  )

```

```{r}
nyc_inspections_tidy %>%
  mutate(cuisine_description = forcats::fct_reorder(cuisine_description, score)) %>%
  plot_ly(y = ~score, color = ~cuisine_description, type = "box")
```

```{r}
nyc_inspections_tidy %>%
  count(borough) %>%
  plot_ly(
    x = ~borough,
    y = ~n,
    color = ~borough,
    type = "bar",
    colors = "viridis"
  ) %>%
  layout(
    title = "Counts of Inspections by Borough",
    xaxis = list(title = "Borough"),
    yaxis = list(title = "Count")
  )
```
